column2: #I wanted to use functions from the course but when I looked up how to recategorise a categorical variable, all the answers were using functions we hadn't used. So, I asked chatgpt. First, it advised a statement for each NHS Board but I knew it could be done in groups and using | or %in% so I modified the prompt.
NHS %in% c("Fife" , "Forth Valley" , "Greater Glasgow & Clyde" , "Lanarkshire" , "Lothian") ~ "Central Belt",
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Region'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
